present participle of
converge
If lines, roads, or paths converge, they move towards the same point where they join or meet: The paths all converge at the main gate of the park. Due to roadworks, three lanes of traffic have to converge into two. Compare
diverge
If ideas and opinions converge, they gradually become similar.
to come from other places to meet in a particular place: Ambulances, police cars, and fire engines all converged on the scene. 100,000 people are expected to converge on the town for the festival.
